data.title: Lunch Stop
data.text: My daughter and I stopped by for lunch after visiting someone on the hospital that is very close to this restaurant. They offer daily specials as well as managers special. We chose the managers. I had the sliced brisket while my daughter had a pulled pork sandwich both fries and sweet ice tea. They offer a number of other side dish's as well. The food is served hot and fresh. It may not be a blue ribbon place but the food is good. Yes I will be back again.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: Soul food sides made with love. I had the sliced beef my friend had the pulled pork....smokey, wonderful flavor for both! Will definitely be going back soon!

data.title: Great BBQ
data.text: My boss walked through office and his lunch smelled so good that I had to go try it for myself.  I had a chopped brisket sandwich, mac and cheese and the pinto beans.  It is sooo good.  The brisket is just right and the BBQ sauce yummy, but the mac and cheese is the best that I have ever had in a restaurant!!! Yes, the beans are also very good. The ladies working there were very nice and friendly. Just like Texas.

data.title: Great food
data.text: This is what Texas BBQ is about.  Not a show place at all from the outside.  In fact most would probably just slowly drive by and continue onward.  Inside... it is walk up to the counter, select and order up your BBQ meal.  Selections include meat plates with two sides fro 10.99 -12.99, sandwiches from 5.99-7.99 or meat by the pound with sauce from 6.99-14.99.  Their daily special is any sandwich with one side and a drink for $8.75.  The ribs were delicious and the seasoned green beans were the best I have had.  I could eat a bowlful of just those.  Everyone in our group of 7 enjoyed their meal.

data.title: Best Texas Bbq
data.text: All our friends told us we HAD to try Texas BBQ. Wow!!! This place doesn't look like much but the food makes up for the lackluster appearance. Huge servings! So you get your money's worth! We had the 2 meat meal...I ordered pulled pork, and ribs with corn and potato salad; my husband had ribs and ham with Mac n cheese and BBQ beans. We ordered different sides on purpose in order to share...everything was delicious!! The staff is friendly and knows their stuff. It's a must try!!

data.title: 2nd choice today
data.text: The restaurant we were headed to was closed for the day so we wound up here.  Second (and last) time we've been here.  I had a sliced brisket sandwich which was loaded with fat (gross!) and just not at all enjoyable.  The two boys working were more interested in getting back to the table where they'd been sitting so they could talk and text.

data.title: Great...great bar-b-gue
data.text:
Let me tell you this restaurant is typical Texas bar-b-gue. Smoked in the traditional oak, hickory, mesquite wood cookers. They cook their meats slow and it just falls off the bones, be it ribs or chicken.  I would recommend the half chicken and half rib platter. Comes with two sides.

The sides are few but awesome. I had mac n cheese and potatoes cooked in butter. Boy it was all so good.

Now the decor is traditional Texas bar-b-que joint so don't expect the Ritz. It is clean and very well maintained.

If you are a local and never been here before, then pass by Dickey's, Riskey's and head straight there. 

PS This is not a chain. It is locally owned and operated by a couple young men who live to cook and live their place. It skows!

data.title: Average
data.text: Slow service and overpriced. Worker complained the whole time that it was his day off and was smiling only because he had too. We finally left because he would not shut up.

data.title: If your in the area this is a great BBQ to try
data.text:
We happened on Poor Daddy's by chance and we weren't disappointed in any way
From the Brisket, to the sausage, ribs, green beans, Mac and cheese (which our grand daughter didn't want to share) 
For dessert our grand daughter share the banana pudding by allowing my wife and I a bite a piece
Did I mention the coleslaw?  It was simple but is a excellent choice to go with the meal.
The house BBQ sauce is a perfect blend and is bounty full for those that want it
The staff (owner) seemed dedicated to making his place a family operated business, build on hard work and service

data.title: Hubby said it was DELICIOUS
data.text: My husband wanted me to do this review and HE NEVER does reviews. He said this place was too good not to review. He really enjoyed the service. Said they gave him a TON of food for a very reasonable price and that the food was REALLY good. He said the meat literally fell off the bone. He even liked the sides of baked beans and potato salad. He is on a mission to try out many different bbq joints when he travels to Texas for business but he said he may not go anywhere else after going here.

data.title: Drove through because I smelled the place from the shopping center next door
data.text: Asked for a sliced beef sandwich and described how I like it delivered.  Found out the owner has been smoking his meet on sight for seven years.  He appreciated that I followed my nose.  The beef was thick sliced, truly tender, no slab of fat through the middle, sauce on the side, no pickles, no onions, and PERFECT!  I'll be back and could not believe living 10 miles up the road I had not heard of this place.  It was that good.  And I grew up eating BBQ on butcher paper, at a picnic table, with paper towels.  The quote on "Poor Daddy's" catering trailer gave me a good laugh.

data.title: Family-owned BBQ - daily specials and close to Harbor Freight Tools
data.text: On a recent Wednesday, my family and I obtained some necessities from Harbor Freight Tools, and gave this BBQ place (located on an adjacent property) a try.  We told our greeter it was our first trip, and he offered us a rib sample, in order to try the "special of the day."  He was proud to announce that the restaurant was "family-owned."  Boy, were we lucky it was "Wednesday - the rib plate day."  The huge, meaty pork ribs - 4 to a plate - were joined by the choice of two sides, a buttery slice of Texas toast, and a drink - all for $12.99.  I've attached a photo of a rib (which I held in front of some of the pig decor in the restaurant), in order that you get some idea of the value.  There's a different special each day, as well as an "owner's special"  combination, involving chicken and another meat.  Give Poor Daddy's a try!

data.title: This is a great example of wanta-be BBQ
data.text: There is a bike path close by, so I wanted this place to be great. The ladies behind the counter, but the food far was less than great. My brisket was fatty and tasteless. The sauce choices reminded me of Kraft bottled brands. Will not be back.

data.title: Great eats
data.text: It is one of the best BBQ places that I have been to. We have been there a few times. Staff is friendly

data.title: Chop beef baked potato is fantastic
data.text: Always friendly always great hey there 4 to 5 times a month always fresh always hot ...always nice conversation to be had

data.title: Good, not great
data.text:
Good stuff. Not great, but definitely good. This is east Texas BBQ style BBQ. I've been twice so far and it's pretty close to my job. Small place, maybe about 8 or 10 tables and booths to sit at. Ordering is cafeteria style, then you pay and sit and enjoy your meal. Condiments and sauce are next to the drinks after you pay. Fair prices, so no problem there.

I tried the ribs on my first visit. Good color, no bark to speak of really but the outside was a think dark good smoky looking skin. They were fall off the bone if that's your thing. On my second visit, I tried the brisket and hot link. The hot link was fine ground and had a nice red casing to it. No memorable flavor, but it reminded me of hot links I used to eat when I was younger. I think I like Earl Campbell's links a little better. I asked for moist brisket, but I think I got some flat instead. Was good, but not what I prefer so I'll pass on the brisket next time.

Ranch potatoes are kind of bland, so won't be getting those again. BBQ beans are good, not much sauce in there which is OK by me. Default bread is a piece of buttered Texas toast.

All around it is a decent place. Ribs special on Wednesday and I think that's the only reason I'll be back.

data.title: After my first visit, I will be a regular!
data.text: I am always nervous to try a new place that's not a chain. I was very impressed, everything I took a bite of tasted delicious. The service was excellent! The only thing that would change it decorative but that's not any reason to keep me from going back! Mac n cheese is awesome! Bomb Banana pudding! Oh yes and I would say the meatiest best ribs I've ever had!

data.title: hmmm
data.text:
BBQ is above average.  I particularly liked the hot links.  Prices are high though.  I couldn't believe how much a sandwich and a half-pound of meat with no sides cost me.  Biggest problem is understanding the people that work behind the counter.  We had serious communication issues; I couldn't understand their grammar and heavy accent and they couldn't understand my English.  No problem if you don't ask questions and order by the number straight off the menu board though.
Liked the rustic small BBQ shack interior.
I’d go back for more, just have to save up some money.
